article_text:
STOCKHOLM—Microsoft Corp.'s foray into making smartphones was dealt a setback as Nokia Corp. said sales of its Lumia Windows line posted a sales decline for the fourth quarter.

The drop was a troubling sign for Microsoft, which is in the process of closing a $7 billion purchase of Nokia's handset business.

When the pact was announced in...

twitter.description: Nokia's handset sales fell 29% in the fourth quarter. The rare decline was a setback to Microsoft, which is acquiring the operation.
twitter.title: Nokia Bodes Ill for Microsoft

image.alt: Nokia reports sales decline of 29% for handset business that Microsoft is acquiring
